action.action-desc: Mr. Cohen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend SAFETEA–LU to ensure that projects that assist the establishment of aerotropolis transportation systems are eligible for certain grants, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Aerotropolis Act of 2015.

section.header: Projects of national and regional significance

subsection.text: Section 1301(c)(2) of SAFETEA–LU (23 U.S.C. 101 note) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term eligible project means any surface transportation project eligible for Federal assistance under title 23, United States Code, including freight railroad projects and activities eligible under such title.

subparagraph.header: Inclusion of aerotropolis transportation system projects
subparagraph.text: The term eligible project includes a combination of projects described in subparagraph (A) that, as a group—

clause.text: assist the establishment of an aerotropolis transportation system; and

subsection.text: Section 1301(c) of SAFETEA–LU (23 U.S.C. 101 note) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term aerotropolis transportation system means a planned and coordinated multimodal freight and passenger transportation network that, as determined by the Secretary, provides efficient, cost-effective, sustainable, and intermodal connectivity to a defined region of economic significance centered around a major airport.
